original_title: Brooklyn: St. Edwards Street - Auburn Place
text:
St. Edwards Street, north from Auburn Place toward the Brooklyn Navy Yard. On the left, where Leo Place meets St. Edwards Street, is the Latteman shoe factory. On the right is Public School No. 67. The dwellings preceding the school were later razed and an annex added to the school.

All the buildings on the west side of the street were later razed, as shown in views 2 and 3, to make way for a new public housing construction. The shoe factory can be seen coming down in the later views, view 3 being north on Leo Place and shows also the public school with its annex.

P. L. Sperr.

View 1: October 31, 1927
Views 2,3: April 22, 1941

original_title: Brooklyn: St. Edwards Street - Auburn Place
text:
St. Edwards Street, at the N. E. corner of Auburn Place, showing the City Park branch of the Brooklyn Public Library. In the background is Cumberland Hospital; on the left Public School No. 67.

P. L. Sperr

View 1: April 27, 1940
Views r. 3: September 6, 1939

View 1 shows the rear of the Library, seen from N. Elliott Place, and the J. J. Latterman shoe factory at St. Edwards and Leo Places.
note: The factory and surrounding buildings were later demolished for the erection of Fort Greene Houses.

original_title: Brooklyn: St. Edwards Street - Auburn Place
text:
1 & 2. St. Edwards Street, north from Auburn Place, showing the City Park branch of the Brooklyn Public Library and Public School No. 67. A new addition to the school is being built. In the background is the U. S. Navy Yard.

P. L. Sperr

September 6, 1939
Views 1,2

3. St. Edwards St. north from Myrtle Ave.

P.L. Sperr

April 11, 1941
